columns.name: target_group_name
columns.description: The name of the target group.

columns.name: target_group_arn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the target group.

columns.name: target_type
columns.description: The type of target that is specified when registering targets with this target group. The possible values are instance (register targets by instance ID), ip (register targets by IP address), or lambda (register a single Lambda function as a target).

columns.name: load_balancer_arns
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Names (ARN) of the load balancers that route traffic to this target group.

columns.name: port
columns.description: The port on which the targets are listening. Not used if the target is a Lambda function.

columns.name: vpc_id
columns.description: The ID of the VPC for the target.

columns.name: protocol
columns.description: The protocol to use for routing traffic to the target.

columns.name: matcher_http_code
columns.description: The HTTP codes to use when checking for a successful response from a target.

columns.name: matcher_grpc_code
columns.description: The gRPC codes to use when checking for a successful response from a target.

columns.name: healthy_threshold_count
columns.description: The number of consecutive health checks successes required before considering an unhealthy target healthy.

columns.name: unhealthy_threshold_count
columns.description: The number of consecutive health checks successes required before considering an unhealthy target healthy.

columns.name: health_check_enabled
columns.description: Indicates whether health checks are enabled.

columns.name: health_check_interval_seconds
columns.description: The approximate amount of time, in seconds, between health checks of an individual target.

columns.name: health_check_path
columns.description: The destination for health checks on the target.

columns.name: health_check_port
columns.description: The port to use to connect with the target.

columns.name: health_check_protocol
columns.description: The protocol to use to connect with the target. The GENEVE, TLS, UDP, and TCP_UDP protocols are not supported for health checks.

columns.name: health_check_timeout_seconds
columns.description: The amount of time, in seconds, during which no response means a failed health check.

columns.name: target_health_descriptions
columns.description: Contains information about the health of the target.

columns.name: tags_src
columns.description: A list of tags associated with target group.
